Race.SpecificTitle: Sub-Road Dist. No. 1 of Road Dist. No. 2B (Wd. 11) -- 15 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sub-Road District No. 1 of Road District No. 2B (Ward 11) Proposition
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall Sub-Road District No. 1 of Road District No. 2B (Ward 11) of the Parish of Rapides, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a fifteen (15) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $258,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and keeping in repair the public roads, highways and bridges and drainage facilities within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sub-Road Dist. No. 2 of Road Dist. No. 2B (Wd. 11) -- 15 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sub-Road District No. 2 of Road District No. 2B (Ward 11) Proposition
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall Sub-Road District No. 2 of Road District No. 2B (Ward 11) of the Parish of Rapides, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a fifteen (15) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $114,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and keeping in repair the public roads, highways and bridges and drainage facilities within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road District No. 6A -- 63.07 Mills Cont. - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Road District No. 6A of the Parish of Rapides, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a sixty-three and seven hundredths (63.07) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $256,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029, for the purpose of constructing, maintaining and keeping in repair the public roads, highways and bridges and drainage facilities within the District, said millage to represent a thirteen and seven hundredths (13.07) mills increase (due to reassessment) over the 50 mills authorized to be levied through the year 2019 pursuant to an election held on July 19, 2008?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 10 -- 29.11 Mills Cont. & Reded. - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 10 Proposition
(Millage Continuation & Rededication)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 10 of the Parish of Rapides, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to continue to levy the tax authorized at an election held on July 19, 2008 (the "Tax"), at a rate of twenty-nine and eleven hundredths (29.11) mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $118,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year) for an additional ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2029, and shall the District be further authorized to rededicate the use of the proceeds of the Tax, heretofore or hereafter received, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating fire protection and emergency medical service facilities, vehicles and equipment, including both movable and immovable property, and including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, said millage to represent a nine and eleven hundredths (9.11) mills increase (due to reassessment) over the 20 mills authorized to be levied through the year 2019 pursuant to the election held on July 19, 2008?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Pineville Prop. No. 1 of 5 -- Wet/Dry-6%PkgAlcoh. - BOA
Race.SummaryText: City of Pineville Proposition No. 1 of 5
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of alcoholic content containing not more than six percent alcohol by volume be permitted by package only and not for consumption on the premises in the City of Pineville, State of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Pineville Prop. No. 2 of 5 -- Wet/Dry-6%ConAlcoh. - BOA
Race.SummaryText: City of Pineville Proposition No. 2 of 5
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of alcoholic content containing not more than six percent alcohol by volume for consumption on the premises be permitted in the City of Pineville, State of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Pineville Prop. No. 3 of 5 -- Wet/Dry-1/2%ConAlcoh. - BOA
Race.SummaryText: City of Pineville Proposition No. 3 of 5
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverage alcohol containing one-half of one percent alcohol by volume and above for consumption on the premises be permitted in the City of Pineville, State of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Pineville Prop. No. 4 of 5 -- Wet/Dry-1/2%PkgAlcoh. - BOA
Race.SummaryText: City of Pineville Proposition No. 4 of 5
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of alcoholic content containing one-half of one percent alcohol by volume and above by the package only and not for consumption on the premises be permitted in the City of Pineville, State of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Pineville Prop. No. 5 of 5 -- Wet/Dry-Restaurant - BOA
Race.SummaryText: City of Pineville Proposition No. 5 of 5
Race.FullText: Shall the sale of beverages of high and low alcoholic content be permitted only on the premises of restaurant establishments which have been issued an "R" permit as defined by law in the City of Pineville, State of Louisiana?

Race.SpecificTitle: Gravity Drainage Dist. No. 2 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall Gravity Drainage District No. 2 of the Parish of Rapides, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $906,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2019 and ending with the year 2028, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating gravity drainage and other flood prevention works permitted by law?
